maml:description.maml:para: Get packages installed with winget.
This command will get a list of all packages installed with winget. These will be packages with winget as the source. This command will have to be revised once more sources are available.
Specify a winget source. Currently, there is really only a single source but this might eventually change.
Specify a winget source. Currently, there is really only a single source but this might eventually change.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WGInstalled
Name ID Version ---- -- ------- Audacity Audacity.Audacity 3.1.3 CCleaner Piriform.CCleaner 5.90 Ubuntu Canonical.Ubuntu 2004.2021.825.0 ...

dev:remarks.maml:para: Actual output should also include the description.

maml:description.maml:para: Get information about a winget package
This command is a PowerShell wrapper aroung winget.cmd that will get a package and create an object you can use in PowerShell. The
Specify the package ID.
Specify a winget source. Currently, there is really only a single source but this might eventually change.
Pipe a winget search to this function.
Specify a winget source. Currently, there is really only a single source but this might eventually change.
Specify the winget moniker.
Specify a winget source. Currently, there is really only a single source but this might eventually change.
Specify the winget package name.
Specify a winget source. Currently, there is really only a single source but this might eventually change.
Specify the package ID.
Pipe a winget search to this function.
Specify the winget moniker.
Specify the winget package name.
Specify a winget source. Currently, there is really only a single source but this might eventually change.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WGPackage -name "Foxit PDF Reader"
Name ID Version Description ---- -- ------- ----------- Foxit PDF Reader Foxit.FoxitReader 11.2.1.53537 Foxit is a powerful PDF reader for viewing, filling out forms and more.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a package by its name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> PS C:\> Get-WGPackage -id "Microsoft.Powershell.Preview" | Select-Object *
Name : PowerShell Preview ID : Microsoft.PowerShell.Preview Version : 7.3.0.2 Publisher : Microsoft Corporation PublisherURL : PublisherSupport : Author : Moniker : pwsh-preview Description : PowerShell is a cross-platform (Windows, Linux, and macOS) automation and configuration tool/framework that works well with your existing tools and is optimized for dealing with structured data (e.g. JSON, CSV, XML, etc.), REST APIs, and object models. It includes a command-line shell, an associated scripting language and a framework for processing cmdlets. Homepage : https://microsoft.com/PowerShell

dev:remarks.maml:para: The output is a rich object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> winget search --tag powerbi | get-wgpackage | Select-Object Name,ID,Version
Name ID Version ---- -- ------- DAX Studio DaxStudio.DaxStudio 2.17.3.683 Microsoft PowerBI Desktop Microsoft.PowerBI 2.102.845.0

dev:remarks.maml:para: You can pipe the results of a winget search command to this function.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the latest release note for winget.
This command will query the Github repository for the winget project and display the release note for the latest version. You can also display it in markdown format or go to the online version.
Create a markdown document.
Open the release note location online using your default web browser.
Get latest preview release.
Create a markdown document.
Open the release note location online using your default web browser.
Get latest preview release.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WGReleaseNote
Name : Windows Package Manager v1.1.12653 Version : v1.1.12653 Published : 9/27/2021 6:08:01 PM Prerelease : False Notes : This release represents our Windows Package Manager 1.release candidate build for Windows 10 (1809+).
Experimental features have been disabled in this release. We will follow this release with another Pre-release "developer" build at GitHub so users can continue with experimental features available.
# Bugs #797 Silent install of "winget install git.git" is not working #1497 Make rename retry more frequently for longer, then try making a hardlink Link : https://github.com/microsoft/winget-cli/releases/tag/v1.1.12653

dev:remarks.maml:para: If running in PowerShell 7, you can use the markdown cmdlets.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WGReleaseNote | Select-Object Name,Version,Published
Name Version Published ---- ------- --------- Windows Package Manager v1.1.12653 v1.1.12653 9/27/2021 6:08:01 PM

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WGReleaseNote -Preview
Name : Windows Package Manager v1.1.12701 Version : v1.1.12701 Published : 9/28/2021 10:30:01 AM Prerelease : True Notes : This release is the first development build after the Windows Package Manager 1.1 release candidate build for Windows 10 (1809+).
Experimental features have been enabled in this release. This build will be released to Windows Insider Dev builds, and Windows Package Manager Insiders.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the release note for the latest preview.

maml:description.maml:para: Get available winget upgrades.
Use this command to get information about available winget upgrades. You can then manually decide what to upgrade using winget or pipe to Invoke-WingetUpgrade.
Specify a package by ID. Wildcards are permitted.
Specify a package by name. Wildcards are permitted.
Specify a package by ID. Wildcards are permitted.
Specify a package by name. Wildcards are permitted.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WGUpgrade
Name ID Version Available ---- -- ------- --------- MozBackup JasnaPaka.MozBackup Unknown 1.5.1 Ruby RubyInstallerTeam.Ruby 3.0.1-1 3.1.0-1 Microsoft Visual C++ 2013 RedistributablΓÇª Microsoft.VC++2013Redist-x64 12.0.30501.0 12.0.40664.0 Java 8 Oracle.JavaRuntimeEnvironment 8.0.3010.9 8.0.3110.11 ...

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> get-wgupgrade p*
Name ID ---- -- Private Internet Access PrivateInternetAccess.PrivateInternet… PowerToys (Preview) Microsoft.PowerToys

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get upgrades with a name that begins with P.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WGUpgrade -id *toys
Name ID Version Available ---- -- ------- --------- PowerToys (Preview) Microsoft.PowerToys 0.55.1 0.56.1

maml:description.maml:para: Install the latest winget release from Github.

Until winget is publically available in the Microsoft Store, you can download and install the latest version from Github. This command must be run in a Windows PowerShell session in Windows 10 or Windows 11. The package requires the Microsoft.VCLibs.140.00.UWPDesktop package. If it isn't found, it will be downloaded and installed.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Display the AppxPackage after installation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Install the latest preview build.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Display the AppxPackage after installation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Install the latest preview build.
Invoke a Winget upgrade on all available upgrades.

This command is designed to make it easy to upgrade winget packages. The command will skip packages with unknown versions. The installation process accepts all licenses and agreements, and uses the silent winget option.
Be aware that winget may still encounter a problem attempting to invoke the update.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specify a package by ID. Wildcards are permitted.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specify a wingetUpgrade object
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specify a package by ID. Wildcards are permitted.
Specify a wingetUpgrade object

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Invoke-WGUpgrade -id Microsoft.VC++2015-2019Redist-x64
Found Microsoft Visual C++ 2015-2019 Redistributable (x64) [Microsoft.VC++2015-2019Redist-x64] Version 14.29.30135.0 This application is licensed to you by its owner. Microsoft is not responsible for, nor does it grant any licenses to, third-party packages. Downloading https://download.visualstudio.microsoft.com/download/pr/d3cbdace-2bb8-4dc5-a326-2c1c0f1ad5ae/9B9DD72C27AB1DB081DE56BB7B73BEE9A00F60D14ED8E6FDE45DAB3E619B5F04/VC_redist.x64.exe Successfully verified installer hash Starting package install... Successfully installed

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WGUpgrade -Name p* | Invoke-WGUpgrade -WhatIf What if: Performing the operation "Upgrade from 3.1.2+06767 to 3.2.0+06857" on target "PrivateInternetAccess.PrivateInternetAcceΓÇª". What if: Performing the operation "Upgrade from 0.47.0 to 0.51.1" on target "Microsoft.PowerToys".

dev:remarks.maml:para: You can pipe output from Get-WGUpgrade to this command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WGUpgrade | Out-GridView -OutputMode Multiple | Invoke-WGUpgrade

dev:remarks.maml:para: Pipe the list of available upgrades to Out-Gridview where you can select items. Invoke-WGUpgrade will then install the selected upgrades.

maml:description.maml:para: Test Winget version
Test-WGVersion is a simple command you use to discover if you need to update winget.
Get a Boolean result indicating if an update is available.
Get a Boolean result indicating if an update is available.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Test-WGVersion
Installed Online Update Command --------- ------ ------ ------- 1.1.13405 1.1.12653 False C:\Users\Jeff\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windo…

dev:remarks.maml:para: The default output is an object showing the currently installed version and the latest stable version online. If an update is available, and you are running in the PowerShell console or VS Code, the Update value will be displayed in Green.
Run the test and get a simple, Boolean result indicating if an update is available.
